description: A simple Node.js application that fetches and displays API data in a Bootstrap-styled webpage.
The JavaScript runtime environment used to build the web server and handle backend logic.

Description: Node Package Manager, used to install dependencies like axios for API requests.
A popular CSS framework used for responsive and clean styling of the webpage.
Core Node.js module used to create the web server and listen to incoming HTTP requests.
A promise-based HTTP client used for fetching data from an external API (JSONPlaceholder).
Contains static assets like Bootstrap CSS and JavaScript files (e.g., script.js).
Code is split into modules for request handling (requestHandler.js) and event logic (events.js).
Graceful error handling is implemented to ensure the app responds correctly when issues occur.
The project is managed using Git, with a full history of commits pushed to GitHub.
